medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening epigastric abdominal pain and nausea without vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced abdominal pain approximately 1 week prior for 2 nights. Symptoms worsened 2 days post ERCP, with persistent abdominal pain and nausea, without vomiting, dyspnea, fever, chills, or chest pain. His post ERCP course was initially uncomplicated. He was transferred to the ED for further care due to these worsening symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, CABG years ago, right-sided groin aneurysm repair years ago, multiple hernia surgeries, pectus excavatum, hyperlipidemia, hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: No history of malignancy; mother with unspecified disease.
